content: Shenzhen-based robotics company announced today that their industrial #humanoidrobot, #WalkerS, is now undergoing "training" at a factory of Chinese electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer . The training regimen involves tasks like adaptive walking for start-stop on the production line, robust mileage calculation, autonomous operation using perception and system data, and task scheduling. Check it out! #Robotics #TechTraining

#China's #PanZhanle set a new world record as he stormed to victory in the men's 100m freestyle at the #ParisOlympics on Wednesday. Pan touched the wall in 46.40 seconds, more than a second ahead of Australian Kyle Chalmers, who took silver. (Xinhua) #Swimming #ParisOlympics2024 #OlympicGames #GoChina

The highly anticipated Phase II extension of Shenzhen #Metro Line 8 is set to open Dec. 28, marking the city’s first direct Metro route to the popular Dameisha and Xiaomeisha beaches. The Phase II extension starts from the existing Yantian Road Station of Phase I, stretching eastward to Xiaomeisha Station, covering a distance of about 8.01 kilometers. It has four stations, namely Hong’anwei, Yantianxu, Dameisha, and Xiaomeisha. #subway #publictransport #shenzhen #travel

The highly anticipated 20th China (Shenzhen) International Cultural Industries Fair (#ICIF) will open today, featuring its main venue in Bao’an and 52 parallel subvenues across various districts. Among them, the subvenue at the Art Design Center in #LuohuDistrict stands out with its diverse exhibitions and workshops tailored for visitors and art enthusiasts alike. This year’s theme, “Artistic Life and Imagination,” brings together enterprises to host seven events, including exhibitions on original designs, digital media, and abstract art. The center also features a market selling various cultural and creative products and offers public workshops on the traditional craft of bamboo basket weaving. Don't miss out! #ICIF2024 #20thICIF #ICIF20Years #culture

A dazzling #drone & #fireworks showwas staged last week in #Marseille to celebrate the arrival of the Olympic flame! The show featured 800 #unmannedaerialvehicles (#UAVs) made by Shenzhen HighGreat Innovation Technology Development Co. Ltd. With a fleet of over 60,000 #drones, the company has presented thousands of drone performances in more than 300 cities around the globe. Its drones will continue to grace the sky above the iconic Palace of Versailles in #Paris with awe-inspiring aerial shows until the end of the #Olympics. #Paris2024

In an innovative leap for #logistics, the delivery time for local delicacies from #GuangmingDistrict to other districts has been halved by using #drone technology, Shenzhen Evening News reported. Fengyi Drones launched its low-altitude logistics route in the district Saturdaymarking a significant step forward in #Shenzhen's goal to establish a comprehensive #lowaltitude logistics network. Previously, it took 40 minutes to deliver Guangming pigeons, a beloved local delicacy, to residents’ hands by car. Now, the delivery time has been slashed to just 20 minutes. This service was showcased at the Fengyi Drone Operation Center in Bao’an District on Saturday. (Video: Shenzhen TV)

The complex is revolutionizing Shenzhen’s commercial landscape with a blend of architectural artistry and over 200 leading brands. Embracing a unique design, MixC Universiade World captures the essence of the Shenzhen Universiade Sports Center Stadium’s energy while incorporating elements of natural beauty. Its spacious layout offers residents a harmonious blend of #commerce and #nature, creating an environment that celebrates the beauty of the outdoors. Follow our photographer Lin Jianping to explore the new landmark!

#JoshuaSZFinds Wherever you go in #Shenzhen, you're always close to a restaurant or #food stall. This city offers an abundance of food, making it a paradise for #foodlovers. Food often takes center stage in my #photography, as I love exploring new dining spots around the city. The food scene in Shenzhen is incredibly diverse, with restaurants from all over China showcasing their unique styles. Capturing these culinary experiences through photography is truly enjoyable. I especially love photographing local gem #restaurants where you can watch the food being prepared right in front of you. These establishments, often with years of history, have their own signature #dishes that keep customers returning. The bustling atmosphere, with waiters and diners moving around, adds to the charm. Exciting news! A multifunctional smart terminal was launched at Metro Line 4’s Shenzhen North Station on Monday. This innovative terminal offers intelligent AI voice inquiries, digital interaction, ticketing, information access, and remote customer service. A first in the domestic rail transport sector! #Shenzhen #SmartCity #Metro #Innovation #TechNews

The third plenary session of the 20th Communist Party of China Central Committee has ushered in a wave of new opportunities and confidence for foreign-funded enterprises operating within the country, according to #KlausZenkel, vice president of the EU Chamber of Commerce in China (EUCCC) and Chairman of the European Chamber South China Chapter. The 20th Central Committee of the CPC passed a pivotal resolution aimed at comprehensively deepening reform to propel Chinese modernization forward during the session, which spanned from Monday to Thursday. Zenkel highlighted the Chinese Government’s commitment to opening up, which stands to benefit foreign investors through increased convenience for foreign investments and the assurance of equal treatment. #DeepeningReform #3rdplenum

On June 22, the #InternationalCittaslowOrganization () has officially bestowed the title of "#InternationalSlowCity" upon Nan'ao Subdistrict in Dapeng New Area, making #Shenzhen the first first-tier city and the first in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao #GreaterBayArea to receive this recognition. The concept of #SlowCities originated in 1986 with the "Slow Food Movement" spearheaded by renowned Italian journalist Carlo Petrini. It advocates for a novel urban development model that harmoniously integrates modern technology with traditional lifestyles, fostering a more balanced and sustainable approach to living within bustling cities. Situated on the southern coast of the Dapeng Peninsula, Nan'ao boasts an exceptional ecological foundation, with a remarkable forest coverage rate of 87%. Its air quality consistently ranks as the best in Shenzhen, earning it the distinction of being the city's first "Zero Industrial Zone" and a rare "Natural Oxygen Bar" in a major metropolis. Additionally, Nan'ao is renowned for its longevity among its residents.

#InDepth Long queues were seen at #ShenzhenUniversity’s (SZU’s) campus canteen last month where teachers and students waited to try a free “AI chicken soup” cooked with black silkie chickens that were gifted by thankful Guizhou farmers. A dozen students from SZU’s #TencentCloud and AI Class developed an #AI-based #farming system for black silkie chickens last year. The Tencent Cloud-based system took eight months of designing and testing before it was launched at a chicken farm in Chishui, Guizhou Province.

Did you know #Shenzhen is #China's most convenient city for #commuters? The recently released 2024 Major Chinese Cities Commuting Monitoring Report shows 81% of people can reach work in under 45 minutes! The report analyzed data from 45 major cities in China. Seven megacities were included — #Beijing, #Shanghai, #Guangzhou, Shenzhen, #Tianjin, #Chongqing, and #Chengdu. Shenzhen’s convenient commute is a result of the city’s efficient, convenient, and intelligent integrated #transportation system and its extensive #publictransport network, the report said. #Commuting #SmartCity How long is your daily commute?

The banks of Houhai River in #Shekou were buzzing with excitement by 7:30 a.m. yesterday, long before the 4th Houhai River #DragonBoatRacekicked off! Despite facing tough competitors right from the start, last year's champions, The Globe Trotters, clinched a spot in the finals! It wasn't all smooth sailing though—during a sharp turn, their boat tipped, sending some team members splashing into the water! Jorieke from the Netherlands, a veteran racer with the Globe Trotters and a #Shenzhen resident for seven years, shared her enthusiasm: "I do have high expectations here!" The race has been organized by Shekou Subdistrict Office to celebrate the traditional #DragonBoatFestival, which is observed on the fifth day of the fifth month on the Chinese lunar calendar. It will fall on June 8 this year. #tradition #ChineseFestivals #shenzhen #China

Two Chinese #scientists, Li Deren and Xue Qikun, won #China's top #scienceaward on Monday for their contributions to the country's #science and #technology development, Xinhua News Agency reported today. Xue, president of the Shenzhen-based , is a renowned experimental #physicist in the field of condensed matter #physics with international acclaim. He led the team to observe the quantum anomalous Hall effect in experiments for the first time. His team also discovered high-temperature superconductivity, pioneering a new research direction in high-temperature superconductivity internationally.

A new residential #property development in #Shenzhen created a sensation Sunday when all 116 of its apartments were sold less than three hours after being listed for presale. The Haideyuan A estate, located in the Antuoshan area, Futian District, became the first residential project in the city to achieve such a remarkable feat since the beginning of this year. The average price of the 116 apartments was 128,500 yuan per square meter. The smallest apartment has an area of 87 square meters and sold for 11.24 million yuan (US$1.5 million), while the biggest is 450 square meters and sold for 59.98 million yuan. #realestatemarket

#China and #Singapore today announced that they will establish a 30-day mutual #visa exemption agreement between both countries. The proposal was announced during the 19th Joint Council for Bilateral Cooperation (JCBC) meeting – the highest-level annual bilateral forum between both countries. This is the first JCBC meeting to be co-chaired by Singapore’s Deputy Prime Minister Lawrence Wong and Chinese Vice Premier Ding Xuexiang. Lawrence Wong said that the #visafree arrangement would “provide greater convenience for people-to-people exchanges," adding that "We hope to surpass pre-epidemic levels on direct flights, which can facilitate more people-to-people exchanges," he said.

#JoshuaSZFinds While much of the news about #China over the past decade has focused on high-speed rail projects, an often-overlooked market is the #bicycle and #ebike industry, which has taken every Chinese city by storm. #Shenzhen, a densely populated city of millions, faces its own set of challenges in providing efficient and convenient #commuting options for everyone. For many residents of Shenzhen, bicycles and e-bikes are the most reliable forms of #transportation. And for those who don’t own a bike, renting one is both simple and accessible. In my ongoing series, I dedicate time to photographing #cyclists and e-bike riders in the heart of Shenzhen. I document the creative ways locals navigate this sprawling city. The transportation choices people make often shape the evolution of public infrastructure. For photographers like me, capturing this transformation is part of the excitement! #photography #photographers #expats #citywalk #cityscape Ins: heysupjosh X: Facebook: Joshua Fernandez

#Foreigners working in #Shenzhen can now enjoy more convenient services as the city has integrated their #workpermits with #socialsecurity cards, according to the city's foreign experts bureau. Starting this month, the work permit information of foreigners will be embedded into their social security cards, allowing them to use both physical and digital cards for various services related to their work and life in #China. With the social security card, foreigners can now enjoy a wider range of services, including financial transactions, healthcare, transportation, and tourism. Foreigners who have already obtained a physical work permit can continue using it until it needs to be renewed or modified, at which point they will follow the new procedures for card integration. For more details and FAQs, please visit the Shenzhen Foreign Experts Bureau website:

#Shenzhen has once again expanded its network of #parks, according to the city's Urban Management and Comprehensive Law Enforcement Bureau. In 2024, the city added 35 new or upgraded parks, bringing the total number of parks to 1,320. At the current rate of visiting one park per day, it would take approximately 3.6 years to explore all of the city’s parks.

Experience the future of transportation at Lianhua Hill Park in Futian District! From now until Dec. 31, residents can take a free ride in a driverless #sightseeing car. These innovative #minibuses are equipped with advanced sensors and can navigate the park safely and efficiently. It's a 6-passenger, L4-level #autonomousvehicle designed as a mobile space. Unlike traditional cars, it has no front or rear and lacks conventional controls like steering wheels and pedals. Don't miss out on this unique opportunity! #driverlesscars #transportation #parks #shenzhen

Exciting news! A new overnight high-speed train service between #Shenzhen and #Chengdu is now available! The D962 train departs from #Shanwei at 7:28 p.m. and arrives at Shenzhen North Railway Station at 8:40 p.m. After an overnight journey, the train is scheduled to reach Chengdu East Railway Station at 7:44 a.m. and #Guangyuan Railway Station at 9:38 a.m. the following day. The total travel time is 14 hours and 10 minutes, with the Shenzhen-Chengdu segment taking 11 hours and four minutes. The train operates on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. According to the 12306 ticketing platform, the fare for a second-class seat on the return D961 train from Chengdu East to Shenzhen North is 552 yuan. A sleeper berth on the upper bunk costs 950 yuan, while a lower bunk is priced at 1,070 yuan. Standing tickets are available for 552 yuan.

Huanggang Checkpoint, the only 24-hour land checkpoint between #Shenzhen and #HongKong, resumed border-crossing services for travelers yesterday. "I am excited and made a trip for a night snack in Shenzhen,” a woman surnamed Liu told reporters.

#Shenzhen's first #underseatunnel opened today! The #MaWanUnderseaTunnel, which is also the largest of its kind in China, officially opened this morning. The project, which began construction in July 2019, is located in the #Qianhai area, a key engine of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao #GreaterBayArea. The #tunnel stretches approximately 8.05 kilometers. It consists of both underground and above-ground sections. The underground portion is a six-lane, bi-directional urban expressway with a designed speed of 80km/h. The above-ground section is a six-lane, bi-directional urban arterial road with a designed speed of 40km/h. The Ma Wan Undersea Tunnel features two underwater tunnel sections, each with a maximum excavation diameter of 15.5 meters, making it the largest underwater tunnel in China.

Since their launch in August 2020, Sino-European train services have transported over 474,000 tons of goods valued at 16.1 billion yuan (US$2.26 billion) to #Europe. Operating on 19 routes connecting #Shenzhen with 44 countries, these #trains have become a vital link in the international #supplychain. Over 100 types of products from the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao #GreaterBayArea, including #electronics, #machinery, and #consumergoods, now reach European markets efficiently via these trains. Customs data shows that export values have grown by over 20% annually, highlighting the logistics corridor's robust performance.

The show will run through Nov. 19.

#Shenzhen welcomed a record 2.76 million #foreignvisitors in 2024, a 100% increase from the previous year, Shenzhen Economic Daily reported. This surge in foreign arrivals places Shenzhen second among Chinese cities. The city also saw a significant increase in non-cash #transactions by foreign visitors, with a total of 146 million transactions worth 19.887 billion yuan. This represents a 62% and 78% increase respectively over the previous year, surpassing the national average. Visitors from #HongKong accounted for a substantial portion of these transactions, with 104 million transactions worth 12.273 billion yuan. #SouthKorea, the #UnitedStates, and #Russia were the top three countries of origin for foreign visitors to Shenzhen, accounting for 14%, 10%, and 8% of total spending, respectively. #Singapore and #Malaysia followed closely behind, with 7% and 6% of spending, respectively. #travel #ChinaTravel #tourism #economy

The #2024ShenzhenLonghuaOpen is underway! The tournament, co-hosted by the Chinese Tennis Association and the Longhua District Government, kicked off yesterday in #LonghuaDistrict. Running through Oct. 20 at the Mission Hills Ecological Sports Park (观澜湖生态运动公社网球场), the event has attracted top #tennis players from 22 countries and regions. Notable participants include several #ATP top 100 players, such as France’s Arthur Cazaux, Australia’s Adam Walton, America’s Mackenzie McDonald and Zachary Svajda, and China’s Bai Yan, Sun Fajing, Cui Jie, and Mo Yecong. This year, the tournament boasts a prize pool of US$133,250, with the winners earning 100 ATP points, according to the organizing committee. #sports #shenzhen

A 26-year-old man has become #Shenzhen’s 800th person, and the country’s 19,098th, to donate hematopoietic stem cells (#HSCs) to an unrelated recipient. The collected HSCs arrived at the recipient’s hospital in Guangzhou the same day for transplantation.

#InDepth #Shenzhen's pivotal role in shaping the future of the #newenergyvehicle (#NEV) industry in #China has been further solidified. Data show the city produced 1.78 million #NEVs last year, accounting for nearly 20% of the national total. This statistic underscores Shenzhen’s manufacturing prowess. Projections suggest that NEV production in Shenzhen will surpass the 2 million mark by 2025, with the industry’s output expected to hit a staggering 1 trillion yuan (US$138 billion). The city’s dominance extends to the charging pile sector, as it holds over half of the country’s market share for charging station equipment. #ElectricVehicles

#InDepth This year #Shenzhen has launched a series of trade-in policies to encourage #consumers to upgrade their old appliances, cars, and other goods for new ones. This program offers #subsidies and #taxbreaks, making it cheaper for consumers to buy new products. The policy has been a success, boosting consumer spending across various sectors. For example, during the Mid-Autumn Festival holiday, the number of consumers purchasing home appliances through trade-ins reached 30,000 daily, with sales revenue nearing 200 million yuan. The trade-in model benefits both consumers and the #economy. Consumers get to upgrade their goods at a discount, while the economy gets a boost from increased #spending. The policy also encourages the purchase of greener and more energy-efficient products. Read more:

#China's Chang'e 6 mission has completed the most important part of its #lunar adventure as its sample-loaded ascender lifted off from the #moon's far side on Tuesday morning. According to the China National Space Administration, the ascender, one of the four major components of the Chang'e 6 robotic probe, started its ascent engine at 7:38 am and flew nearly 6 minutes before reaching a lunar orbit. The mission has collected #lunarsamples in the past two days, and they are sealed inside a container on the ascender. (Source: China Daily)

The #ShenzhenMetro network recorded 10.25 million passenger trips Friday, surpassing the previous single-day record of 10.17 million set on Dec. 31. On Friday, the passenger intensity of the #Metro network reached 18,400 passenger trips per kilometer, ranking it the busiest Metro network in #China. The 16 lines (including trams) operated by Shenzhen Metro Group witnessed a combined total of 9.45 million passenger trips. Notably, Line 5 handled 1.44 million passenger trips, followed by Line 10 with 571,000 trips, Line 12 with 537,000 trips, and Line 14 wth 558,000 trips.

#Shenzhen released four action plans March 3, outlining the city's development in #ArtificialInteligence, including #AI-powered terminals, embodied intelligent #robots, and the growth of gazelle and unicorn companies, Shenzhen Special Zone Daily reported yesterday. The "Shenzhen Action Plan to Accelerate the Development of a Pioneering Artificial Intelligence City (2025-2026)" provides a comprehensive overview of the city's AI development for the next two years. By 2026, the city aims to have more than 3,000 AI enterprises, over 10 unicorn companies, an average annual growth rate of over 20% in the AI industry, and the establishment of more than 10 innovative incubators for AI and embodied intelligent robots. The plan also aims to create an environment characterized by open application scenarios, accessible computing power, a robust industrial ecosystem, and convenient #innovation and #entrepreneurship.

#China will strengthen its handling of criminal cases involving #drunkdriving, according to a set of guidelines released yesterday. Jointly issued by the Supreme People’s Court, the Supreme People’s Procuratorate, the Ministry of Public Security, and the Ministry of Justice, the guidelines, which will take effect Dec. 28, specified 15 scenarios subject to heavier punishment under the law, including recidivism. These guidelines noted 10 scenarios where suspension of sentence shall not apply. For example, cases that lead to traffic accidents and pose a significant danger will be subject to a heavier punishment. If drunk driving also accompanies other crimes, such as hit-and-run, the individual will be convicted and held to a stricter criminal responsibility.

The #HKSARGovernment has proposed to the Central Government further enhancements on Mainland residents’ tourism visit endorsements to #HongKong, including resuming the “multiple‑entry” Individual Visit Endorsements for #Shenzhen residents and expanding the coverage of pilot cities for implementing policies on the “one trip per week” Individual Visit Endorsements, according to the Hong Kong Chief Executive's 2024 Policy Address released today. Additionally, to foster closer people ties with #ASEAN countries, starting today, the Government will relax the criteria for nationals of #Cambodia, #Laos and #Myanmar applying for multiple‑entry visas for travel and business, and extend the validity period of multiple‑entry visas for these countries from two years to three years. The arrangement also applies to #Vietnamese, who have benefitted from the relaxation of the visa policy since last year.

Yesterday, #UniversalMusicGroup () announced that the newly established #UniversalMusicChinaGreaterBayArea will be headquartered in #Shenzhen, a move that aims to cultivate emerging local #musical talent. As one of the three largest music companies in the world, alongside Sony Music Group and Warner Music Group, #UniversalMusic is the first major music production company to specifically target the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area (#GBA). Adam Granite, executive vice president of market development at Universal Music Group, said that Universal Music China GBA is part of the group’s global development strategy. “We will deeply root ourselves in the local culture, enhance support for local artists, and continuously elevate the position of the #Chinesemusic market within the global #music industry, allowing the world to hear the unique sounds of China,” he explained.

More than 200 local primary and secondary schools in Shenzhen have taken measures to make noon naps more comfortable for students, allowing them to lie down during lunch breaks. Most students nap at their desks, but experts have warned that the practice is bad for children’s physical development. #China #Shenzhen #students #nap #lunchbreak #school #study

#Malaysia will grant 30-day #VisaFree #travel for #Chinese citizens starting Dec. 1 this year, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim announced Sunday. This move is to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between #Malaysia and #China next year, Anwar said in his remarks at the annual congress of People's Justice Party, of which he is the president. Anwar also thanked China for its decision to implement a unilateral visa-free policy for ordinary passport holders from Malaysia. (Source: Xinhua) #Asia #travelers #InternationalTravel
